channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Council blue bag of rubbish uncollected, 26th June
item.description:
A blue bag of rubbish I presume collected by the council has been left on the pavement for the past two days. Foxes are now getting at it, and small bits of rubbish debris are collecting around it. This stretch of the street is a hot spot for fly tipping. If the council itself can't collect its own rubbish it sets a really bad precedent for other fly tippers, and we the residents suffer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Copleston Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Finsbury Park Road, 26th June
item.description:
The amount of street litter is getting worse in the area. People clearly have a disregard for the residents and cleanliness of the street and drop litter at base of trees or on road. Do Hackney council provide regular street cleaning?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeding request, 26th June
item.description:
The requests for weeding this area over the last 12 months has seen no attendance. More recently enviromental services have requested twice the area be cleared, despite their own escalation of the request still, no attendance. Pest control have sent no less than 12 reports over 24 months requesting the area from 14-26 Dunton Road be cleared from very overgrown weeds which cause difficulty for them to do their jobs. Please do not mark the job as fixed when it is not!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Dunton Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12 Dunton Road Premier Shop Fire risk, 26th June
item.description:
The over production of trade waste at premier shop and the unhygenic practices by all staff is a serious fire and safety risk to all residential properties that sit in the area by the side of and above this property. the back of the property is being used as a dumping ground by the staff while they pass blame onto others when questioned by southwark enviromental services. this is a residential area, staff should be reminded of their responsibilities as a trader and the negative repercussions of their behaviour. premier staff leave the premises each day while residents have to smell and see the decaying of the neighbourhood. pest control have repeatedly asked for action from enviromantal services 12+ reports since 2024 and no action has been taken. imstead the estate cleaner is left with the unreasonable task of clearing the trade waste. with no warnings to premier staff their unhygenic practices continue. please ensure action. do not mark as fixed when it is not. should no action be taken within the 10 day lawful period, a private company will be hired to clean the area and the invoice will be payable by southwark as per southwark procedure and rules

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazel Way, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
